Simplified settings with a single "Custom room & device order" option

sections.title: Bug Fixes
items: Fixed an issue where items would jump around when reordering favorites
Improved visual consistency in favorites edit mode

releases.summary: This update brings the all-new Favorites view – a dedicated tab where you can pin your most-used devices and scenes for quick access. We're also rolling out a few improvements from earlier today that you might have missed.
releases.seoSummary: Introducing Favorites: pin your most-used Home Assistant devices, scenes, and sensors for instant control. Drag and drop to customize your smart home dashboard with temperature sensor display on room cards.

sections.title: New Features
items: Favorites tab for instant access to your most important controls
Drag and drop to reorder devices, scenes, and sensors in any room
Select multiple items and move them together
Choose to keep your room and device order local or sync it to Home Assistant (Settings → Advanced)
The first temperature sensor now shows on the room card
News section in settings to stay up to date with Stuga
Quick links to give feedback and join discussions (Settings menu)

sections.title: Improvements
items: Faster dashboard loading with cached layouts
Smoother login flow with instant redirect after connecting
Clearer indication of where hidden devices are synced
Simplified room order settings
Better visual feedback when selecting multiple devices

sections.title: Bug Fixes
items: Fixed crash on Huawei and other non-Google Play Services Android devices

releases.summary: This update brings a much-requested feature: you can now reorder devices, scenes, and sensors within your rooms! We've also added a news section to settings and made several quality-of-life improvements.
releases.seoSummary: Drag and drop to organize devices, scenes, and sensors in your Home Assistant dashboard rooms. Customize your smart home layout with multi-select and sync to Home Assistant via labels.

sections.title: New Features
items: Drag and drop to reorder devices, scenes, and sensors in any room
Choose to keep your room and device order local or sync it to Home Assistant via labels (Settings → Advanced)
The first temperature sensor will be the one that shows in the room card
Select multiple items and move them together
News section in settings to stay up to date with Stuga

sections.title: Improvements
items: Clearer indication of where hidden devices are synced
Simplified room order settings
Better visual feedback when selecting multiple devices

releases.summary: This release brings a refreshed settings experience and several quality-of-life improvements.
releases.seoSummary: Refreshed settings menu and improved touch-friendly room reordering for the Home Assistant smart home dashboard with better floor management.

sections.title: Improvements
items: Settings now opens as a full-screen menu sliding in from the right for easier navigation
Settings button moved to the top-right corner with a cleaner icon
Added a logout option when connection is lost, so you can switch servers more easily
Improved room reordering with better touch-based swiping
Cleaner layout when your home doesn't have multiple floors

sections.title: Bug Fixes
items: Fixed rooms sometimes not appearing when assigned to a missing floor
Hidden technical entities (config/diagnostic) that aren't meant for daily use

releases.summary: This release brings temperature display improvements and better support for Android sideloading.

releases.summary: Control which smart home devices appear in your Home Assistant dashboard with new device visibility options.
releases.seoSummary: Control which smart home devices appear in your Home Assistant dashboard with new visibility settings. Hide lights, switches, and sensors per-app or globally.

sections.title: New Features
items: You can now choose to hide devices either just in Stuga or in Home Assistant too - giving you more control over what shows up where

sections.title: Improvements
items: Better error messages when there are SSL/TLS or DNS connection issues, making it easier to troubleshoot connection problems

releases.summary: Improved Home Assistant connection setup with smarter URL detection for both local and remote access.
releases.seoSummary: Smarter Home Assistant connection setup with automatic URL detection for local and remote smart home access. No manual configuration needed.

sections.title: Improvements
items: Smarter URL handling when setting up your connection - the app now automatically tries different protocols (http/https) and suggests alternatives if your initial URL doesn't work
When multiple connection options are found, you can now easily pick the one that works best for you

sections.title: Bug Fixes
items: Fixed an issue where the setup wizard wouldn't scroll properly when the keyboard appeared
Fixed a timing issue that could cause connection testing to behave unexpectedly
